com.ragego.engine

Class ScoreCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ragego.engine.ScoreCounter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameListener, TurnListener

    public class ScoreCounter
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameListener
    Counter for player scores in the game. This function manage score between players during a game and help to determine if a party is ended.
    Since:
    1.0

      • newStoneAdded

        public void newStoneAdded(Stone stone)
        Description copied from interface: GameListener
        Informs a Stone is added on the board. This function is called before dead stones are computed. Take care, if an IA edit manually the board, this function could not be call.
        Specified by:
        newStoneAdded in interface GameListener
        Parameters:
        stone - The stone which was added.

      • stoneRemoved

        public void stoneRemoved(Stone stone)
        Description copied from interface: GameListener
        Informs a Stone is removed from the board. This function is called after the stone has been deleted.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        stone - The stone which has been removed.

      • newTurn

        public void newTurn(GameBoard board,
                    Player player)
        Description copied from interface: TurnListener
        Run app_logic for this turn. When game engine end to call each turn listener, the turn is ended.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        board - The board on which we are playing
        player - The player who have to play

      • endOfTurn

        public void endOfTurn(GameBoard board,
                      Player player,
                      Player nextPlayer)
        Description copied from interface: TurnListener
        Run an ends of turn. This function is call at an end of turn. We suppose that you won't edit the game. Score and state are already computed.
        Specified by:
        endOfTurn in interface TurnListener
        Parameters:
        board - The board on which we are playing
        player - The player who has played
        nextPlayer - The player who will play

      • startOfTurn

        public void startOfTurn(GameBoard board,
                        Player player,
                        Player previousPlayer)
        Description copied from interface: TurnListener
        Run a start of turn. This function is call at an end of turn. We suppose that you won't edit the game. Score and state are already computed.
        Specified by:
        startOfTurn in interface TurnListener
        Parameters:
        board - The board on which we are playing
        player - The player who will played
        previousPlayer - The player who has played
